patterns: How many years does it take to complete the imtech course?
responses: The Integrated M.Tech. program is a 5-year integrated program intended for students who have completed or are completing Plus Two (or equivalent). At the end of five years of the program, successful students get dual degrees of B.Tech and M.Tech. You can pursue the programme in CSE or ECE domain.

patterns: What was previous year's cutoff for the imtech course?
responses: In 2021, admission offers were made up to NTA Ranking 6000 for CSE and 7200 for ECE. In 2020, admission offers were made up to NTA Ranking 7300 for CSE and 9000 for ECE. In 2019, admission offers were made up to NTA Ranking 8718 for CSE and 10972 for ECE. The NTA Ranking cutoff for 2022 will depend on the actual applications received.

patterns: How were your previous year placements for the imtech course?
responses: During IIIT Bangalore Placements 2021, a total of 543 offers were made among which 238 were full time offers. 17 students opted out from placements. The highest CTC of INR 45.6 LPA & the average CTC for cse - INR 25.00 LPA and for ece - INR 21.97 LPA were offered to the students. Top Recruiters like Apple, Analog Devices, Amazon, Adobe, AppDynamics, Cisco etc participated in the placement drive.

patterns: In which domains, can i specialize in ece course?
responses: The courses in iMTech ECE cover wide range of core topics including Circuit theory, Digital Communication, Microprocessor and microcontrollers, Computer Architecture, Digital Design, Computer Networking, Operating systems, and current technology topics such as Artificial intelligence, Machine learning, ASIC design, Processor Architecture, VLSI subsystems, Robotics, Real time operating systems and many others.

patterns: In which domains, can i specialize in cse course?
responses: The courses in iMTech CSE cover wide range of core topics including algorithms, automata theory, discrete maths,  Computer Architecture, Digital Design, Computer Networking, Operating systems, and current technology topics such as Artificial intelligence, Machine learning, Approximate algorithms, Software defined network, Real time operating systems and many others.
Happy to help!
